title: Understanding Absolute Cell Referencing
text: Absolute cell referencing is used when you want a cell reference to remain constant, even when you copy the formula to another cell.

title: Identifying Absolute References
text: Absolute references are denoted by a dollar sign ($) before the column letter and row number, like $A$1.

hintAnswer: a cell reference that is constant as the formula is copied into the destination area
title: What is absolute cell referencing?
text: Choose the correct definition of absolute cell referencing.
choices: a cell reference that is constant as the formula is copied into the destination area
a cell reference that varies as the cell reference is copied into the destination area
a cell reference where one factor is constant while the other values
